    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Demanded demonstration of functionality for block 2 by using the given countingSort example

      • addTransitionFromLine

        void addTransitionFromLine(TuringMachine<java.lang.Character> machine,
                         java.lang.String line)
        Adds a transition to the given machine based on the given line. The line must be in a very specific format. This method is only used for the block2-demonstration/example

      • run

        public void run()
        Performs transitions until the machine is in an accepted state or until no transition is available.

      • transit

        public void transit()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs a single transition based on the input that is read from the tapes with the current tape-head positions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the machine already is in an accepted state
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no transition for the given input.

      • getTapeCount

        public int getTapeCount()
        Returns:
        the amount of tapes in this machine

      • getTapes

        public MultiTape<T> getTapes()
        Returns:
        a MultiTape object that represents all the tapes of this machine

      • processOutput

        public void processOutput(TuringTransitionOutput<T> output)
        Processes the output of a transition by writing the new data to the tapes and moving the tape-heads.
        Specified by:
        processOutput in class AbstractFiniteStateMachine<MultiTapeReadWriteData<T>,TuringTransitionOutput<T>>
